description: Borrowed from Japanese 折(お)り紙(がみ) (origami), from 折(お)り (ori, “to fold”) + 紙(かみ) (kami, “paper”).

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The Japanese art of paper folding.
(countable) A piece of art made by folding paper.
(uncountable) The materials science technology that applies the art of origami to products.
(uncountable) The materials science that studies origami applications in various material.
(uncountable) The mathematics field that studies folding two-dimensional surfaces into three-dimensional structures, using folds and creases akin to those in the art of origami.

verbs.description: origami (third-person singular simple present origamis, present participle origamiing, simple past and past participle origamied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To construct by means of decorative paper folding.
examples: He snatched my serviette and swiftly origamied a swan.
